Module SC2002
Package fsmjdoc

Class Order

java.lang.Object
fsmjdoc.Order
public class Order extends Object
The Order class represents a customer's order in the system. It contains information about the order such as order ID, items, order cost, status, pickup time, and more.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor for creating a new order.

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order()
      Constructor for creating a new order. Initializes the order with a unique ID, an empty list of items, and default values for other fields.

  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public void addItem(MenuItem item)
      Adds a menu item to the order and updates the order cost.
      Parameters:
      item - The MenuItem object to add to the order.

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem(MenuItem item)
      Removes a menu item from the order and updates the order cost.
      Parameters:
      item - The MenuItem object to remove from the order.

    • markAsReadyToPickUp

      public void markAsReadyToPickUp()
      Marks the order as ready for pickup and sets the pickup time to the current time.

    • checkForAutoCancellation

      public void checkForAutoCancellation()
      Checks if the order should be automatically canceled based on the time since it was ready for pickup.

    • printOrder

      public void printOrder()
      Prints the details of the order including order ID, items, total cost, and order type (takeaway or dine-in).

    • setTakeaway

      public void setTakeaway(boolean isTakeaway)
      Sets whether the order is for takeaway or dine-in.
      Parameters:
      isTakeaway - True if the order is for takeaway, false if dine-in.

      public boolean isTakeaway()
      Returns whether the order is for takeaway.
      Returns:
      True if the order is for takeaway, false if dine-in.
